before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bp89h","text":"Use ThermoFisher Kit to directly electroporate ESCs with Cas9 protein and sgRNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caedn","text":"Works better than plasmid transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dgb4h","text":"This protocol describes a method for knockin of a 3X flag tag onto the N-terminus of the EEA1 gene in human H9 ES cells using CAS9 and an ultramer oligonucleotide homologous recombination template ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Electroporation of Cas9 protein into human pluripotent stem cells

forks.title: CRISPR tagging of the EEA1 gene with a FLAG epitope in H9 ES TMEM192-HA cells for Endo-IP and Lyso-IP
CRISPR tagging of the TMEM192 gene with 3xHA in H9 ES AAVS-NGN2 cells for Lyso-IP

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"85iaa","text":"Add   to a sterile 1.5 ml tube. Add  . Then add  . Pipet up and down to mix. Let it sit at   for  . This is enough for 2 transfections (== one 6 well).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":91,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":97,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8abdk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"D0A63B306AFC11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"buffer R ","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","guid":"DB8F0C206AFC11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"purified Cas9 protein (2mg/ml)","unit":4}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.2","guid":"EBD241606AFC11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"sgRNA","unit":4}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F71B5AC06AFC11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"","unit":32}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"FA0904D06AFC11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

cases.title: gRNA are FLAG repair template
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"glg7","text":"sgRNA target sequence: gtggtggttaaaccatgtta","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7svi","text":"Ultramer for generating 3xFLAG-3xggs-EEA1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1tgd","text":"gcagggtctggagagtcaccgcggcggcgccgggtggtggttaaaccatgGACTACAAAGACCATGACGGTGATTATAAAGATCATGACATCGATTACAAGGATGACGATGACAAGGGCGGATCCGGGGGAAGCGGCGGATCCttaaggaggattttacagagggtaagagagtgaaaccgtctttctggcagcacgtg","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rt6e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mcua","text":"PCR primers for generating EEA1-N-terminal-Knockin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uri7","text":"Employ Geneart Precision gRNA Synthesis kit according to manufacturer instructions (Thermo Fischer, A29377)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"div39","text":"Use the following primers together with Tracr Fragment PCR template for PCR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53ena","text":"Forward: 5'-TAATACGACTCACTATAG gtggtggttaaaccatgtta","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ehm7","text":"Reverse: 5'-TTCTAGCTCTAAAAC taacatggtttaaccaccac ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nkqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ahj4","text":"Synthesize gRNA using T7 polymerase as described by maufacturer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2mml4","text":"While waiting for the Cas9 to bind to sgRNA, individualize cells with Accutase. Neutralize Accutase with 5x volume E8 with Rock inhibitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frfk4","text":"Count cells. You will need 2x105 for each transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":31,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34tgd","text":"Spin down cells. Let it sit for a while so all the residue media can go down to the bottom of the tube. If the residue media is too much, take it out with a P200 pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"884uq","text":"Resuspend cells to a concentration of 2x105 per 5 μl (ie 4x107 per ml) using buffer R. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":61,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkktv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75te8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7bo08","text":"You don’t have to take all the residue media off but you will need to take into account the volume of residue media so you are not too much off.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73qmc","text":"Prepare a 24 well matrigel coated plate. Add  -  to the wells you will use. Add HAS (1:2500) to each well. Each transfection goes into one well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","guid":"71919AD06AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"7D4C88D06AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"E8+ rock inhibitor (1:1000)","unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"80d4j","text":"Wipe the Neon pipet station with EtOH and place it inside the hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8l631","text":"Add   to the neon tube. Place the tube inside the station. You should feel a click before the tube is securely seated in the station.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"3","guid":"AD9C3DA06AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"electrolytic buffer (buffer E)","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2gtr","text":"Use program 13 from the optimization tab for electroporation parameter. Program 9 should also work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kk2l","text":"When everything is ready, mix  -  with the Cas9+RNA containing R buffer. The final volume should be in the range of  - .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":116,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"DCDCF3706AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"11","guid":"D90C15506AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"of resuspended cells","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"21","guid":"E495BA206AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"22","guid":"E7FA1AD06AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jj32","text":"Take up a neon tip, pipet   and electroporate with program 13. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e80k1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mq85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"F7C2EFF06AFD11EB9D5899190F2448E5","id":0,"label":"cell protein mix","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"62vf1","text":"It is important to pipet slowly to avoid air bubble formation. It is also important to insert the pipet slowly into the station, especially during the end of the insertion when you will feel a click. I normally help the pipet down slowly during the clicking so there is no sudden movement of the tip, which might create tiny air bubbles.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hic8","text":"If you see air bubble in the tip, take it out, push everything out of the tip and repipet the mixture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq0ep","text":"If you see sparking during the electroporation, your efficiency will reduce significantly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d24q8","text":"Once electroporation is complete, push everything into one well of a 24 well plate. Do not pipet up and down with Neon tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beu59","text":"Repeat the same procedure with the same tip and the left over cell mixture. This is just a replicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ave6c","text":"Disperse cells evenly in the well and place cells in a low O2 incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qg0c","text":"Put electroporated cells into low oxygen incubator for 2 days to help maintain viability. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhf8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Expansion of clones for sequencing by MiSeq
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1f622","text":"Sort cells into single wells of 96 well plates and keep cells in E8 medium + 10% Clone R2 (STEMCELL Technologies), and put cells into a low-oxygen incubator for 3-4 days till colonies are visible under the microscope, then move cells to a regular incubator. Change media with regular E8 every other day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Expansion of clones for sequencing by MiSeq
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bot9p","text":"10-14 days post sorting, split cells in 2 sets; 1 set for sequencing (Miseq) and the other for expansion. Keep cells in 10µM Rock inhibitor and 12.5µg/ml human serum albumin(HSA) while splitting. Consolidate cells while splitting if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Expansion of clones for sequencing by MiSeq
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3pon4","text":"Sequencing by Miseq (Illumina):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"721s6","text":"\t-  Make lysate by incubating cells in PBND solution (50mM KCl, 10mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.3, 2.5mM MgCl2-6H2O, 0.45% NP-40, 0.45% Tween-20) with 0.2% protease K (Qiagen) for 5 min at 37°C, and transfer lysate to a PCR plate and run the program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":101,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37ndo","text":"\t    55°C for 30min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5v4p","text":"\t    99°C for 15min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a18jd","text":"\t    Hold at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r4tm","text":"-         Perform the first round of PCR to amplify the region of interest using gene-specific primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efali","text":"\tFor each sample, we do a 10 μl PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2shmp","text":"                2x Master Mix (NEB Next Ultra II Q5): 5 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnd0h","text":"                Primer 1 [5'-ACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCTaccccgagtagtgagtggc](100 μM): 0.07 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kulr","text":"                Primer 2 [5'-GTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCTcacgtgctgccagaaagac] (100 μM): 0.07 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j70k","text":"                Water: 3.86 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fakjj","text":"                Lysate: 1 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l8dm","text":"\tRun a 20-cycle PCR using appropriate annealing temp and extension time using the following sequence. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7l62","text":"1.    98°C, 30 sec                 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84qde","text":"2.    98°C, 10 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t4","text":"3.    64°C, 15 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3mjb","text":"4.    72°C, 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em3u4","text":"5.    Go to b for additional 19 cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8or2k","text":"6.    72°C, 2 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27o35","text":"7.    4°C, hold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19n1u","text":"Note: Primer 1 and Primer 2 amplify the genomic region of interest. Each primer contains partial Illumina adaptor serving as anchor sites for the 2nd round of PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hhk4","text":"-          Perform the second round of PCR by universal primers that contains attachment site for the flow cells and index sequences","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv4v5","text":"\tFor each sample, we do a 10 μl PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s3td","text":"  2x Master Mix (NEB Next Ultra II Q5): 5 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hunc","text":"\tPrimer CDI 666 (100 uM): 0.1 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecogu","text":"  Primer index (10 μM): 1 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fu0l","text":"   Water: 2.9 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o131","text":"  Product from 1st round of PCR: 1 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bvmu","text":" Run a 20-cycle PCR using appropriate annealing temp and extension time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qfot","text":"Subject to MiSeq using manufacturers protocols (MiSeq Kit #MS-102-3001).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
